channel.description: YouTube Video Resources Slides Python also includes another method of building strings, which are known as “F-strings”. F-strings allow us to put placeholders in strings that are later replaced with values from variables, effectively creating a way to build “templates” that can be used throughout our program. The easiest way to see how this works is looking at a few examples. Let’s start with a simple one: name = input("Enter your name: ") print(f"Hello {name}") If the user inputs "Willie Wildcat" when prompted, then this code will produce this output:
